channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Household items dumped, 19th January
item.description:
Huge pile of household items dumped and someone sorting through it whilst I took photo. Don’t think they are responsible just see an opportunity. It’s blocking the pavement so no access for wheelchair users, pushchairs or those with walking aids. It’s now a right mess after it was gone through, earlier it was in bags now they’ve all been ripped open.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Church Manorway, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bikes blocking pavement of Seymour Street near Hyatt hotel, 19th January
item.description:
Lime bikes blocking pavement of Seymour Street near Hyatt hotel need to clear out and fix it causing nuisance and hazard for pedestrian.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-9, Seymour Street, Marylebone, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping outside this building site - perennial issue., 19th January
item.description:
Bags of rubbish and household items are consistently dumped outside building site.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hackney Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Collapsed noisy manhole cover at 257-259 Brixton road SW9 6AG, 19th January
item.description:
I like to report a collapsed manhole cover at 257-259 Brixton Road SW9. The cover is fairly large and has been damaged for the last three months. The tarmac around it has completely crumbled away. This particular lane tends to have heavy weight vehicles such as buses or lorrys passing over it. The noise is a very loud clanking of metal plates. Please can this matter be urgently looked into at your earliest convenience since its been like this for some while.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 194, Brixton Road, Oval, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain is blocked to near the top, 19th January
item.description:
This drain has been blocked for a while. The roads are not swept regularly and the pollution from the road along with dropped rubbish has accumulated down the drain blocking it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Elmers End Road, Upper Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bulk rubbish left by bins for months, 19th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pownall Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: These barriers were left by a demolition crew. When I asked them to take them away I was told “it’s none of your fucking business”., 19th January
item.description:
A company called Roslyne commissioned a demolition crew to clear the empty building on datchelor place. They did not have a licence but parked on the street and put the bollards along Datchelor Place. They were made to leave but left all the bollards behind.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Datchelor Place, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
